intro: Specklinia minutalis, commonly known as the miniature speckled orchid, is a small epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate, speckled leaf patterns. The plant typically produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often clustered in a raceme. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining potting media. Due to its delicate nature, it is often cultivated as a rare ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
